thread.title: Prime Minister urged to act over death of British man in Ukraine
thread.title_full: Prime Minister urged to act over death of British man in Ukraine | West Country - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Prime Minister urged to act over death of British man in Ukraine
text:
The Prime Minister is being urged to intervene in the case of a Devon man killed in unexplained circumstances in Ukraine.
Barry Pring from Bradninch died in 2008 after being hit by an unmarked vehicle while in Kiev.
Barry Pring with his wife on his wedding day. Credit: Shaughan Pring Mystery over the death of a Devon man in Eastern Europe An inquest recently returned a verdict of unlawful killing . His family believe he was murdered.
Brother of Barry Pring says he's desperate to find out exactly what happened to him Today his case was raised in the Commons by his MP Neil Parrish:
Play video Click to hear the Prime Minister's response:
Play video It's not for the British government to interfere in the legal processes of another country, but the Foreign Office has been regularly raising this case with the Ukrainian authorities and will continue to do so.
– Theresa May Last updated Wed 22 Feb 2017 Barry Pring Ukraine
